transcript:
head with its gray curls, she stood surveying the guests, and leisurely arranged her wide sleeves as if rolling them up. Mdrya Dmitrievna always spoke in Russian. 
"Health and happiness to her whose name day we are keeping and to her children," she said, in her loud, full-toned voice which drowned all others. "Well, you old sinner," she went on, turning to the count who was kissing her hand, "you're feeling dull in Moscow, I daresay? Nowhere to hunt with your dogs? But what is to be done,
